text:
Frame 1
- State: The workspace is visible with a plastic drawer unit on the right. The robot’s end-effector is not yet at the drawer; it appears to be at a distant/home pose. No contact with the drawer or handle.
- Action: None yet beyond positioning; the arm is idle or in an approach-ready state.

Assessment
- The strategy (e.g., approach → align → grasp → pull) has not yet been executed. No failure mode is evident; we’re simply at the initial stage.

What to do next (high level)
- Move to a pre-grasp pose in front of the target drawer’s handle or lip, aligned normal to the drawer face.
- Verify alignment with visual/pose checks; adjust yaw/roll so gripper pads are parallel to the drawer front.
- Close the gripper on the handle/lip, apply a straight pull along the drawer’s slide axis while monitoring force.
- If contact is missed or slip is detected, back off, re-align, and re-attempt with slower approach and higher grasp force.
